intro: Fissistigma ellipticum, commonly known as the elliptic fissistigma, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its elliptical leaves and small, clustered flowers that typically bloom in spring. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in tropical gardens.
